commands.name: az network express-route port create
commands.syntax:
az network express-route port create --name
                                     --resource-group
                                     [--bandwidth]
                                     [--billing-type {MeteredData, UnlimitedData}]
                                     [--encapsulation {Dot1Q, QinQ}]
                                     [--location]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--peering-location]
                                     [--tags]
examples: az network express-route port create --bandwidth 200 --encapsulation Dot1Q --location westus2 --name MyExpressRoutePort --peering-location westus --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network express-route port delete
commands.syntax:
az network express-route port delete [--ids]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--yes]
examples: az network express-route port delete --name MyExpressRoutePort --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network express-route port generate-loa
commands.summary: Generate and download a letter of authorization for the requested ExpressRoutePort.

commands.name: az network express-route port list
examples: az network express-route port list --resource-group myresourcegroup

commands.name: az network express-route port show
commands.summary: Get the details of an ExpressRoute port.
examples: az network express-route port show --name MyExpressRoutePort --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network express-route port update
commands.summary: Update settings of an ExpressRoute port.
commands.syntax:
az network express-route port update [--add]
                                     [--billing-type {MeteredData, UnlimitedData}]
                                     [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--remove]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--set]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--tags]
examples: az network express-route port update --name MyExpressRoutePort --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network express-route port wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
